help.short: The subnet name.
The virtual network (VNet) name.
Expands referenced resources. Default value is None.
The subnet name.
The virtual network (VNet) name.
The subnet name.
The virtual network (VNet) name.
The address prefix for the subnet.
Space-separated list of address prefixes in CIDR format.
Space-separated list of services to whom the subnet should be delegated, e.g., `Microsoft.Sql/servers`.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a subnet. This name can be used to access the resource.
Describes the actions permitted to the service upon delegation
The name of the service to whom the subnet should be delegated (e.g. Microsoft.Sql/servers).
Name or ID of a network security group (NSG).
Name or ID of a route table to associate with the subnet.
An array of service endpoint policies.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
A collection of service endpoint policy definitions of the service endpoint policy.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.
Service endpoint name.
A list of service resources.
Resource tags.
An array of service endpoints.
A list of locations.
The provisioning state of the resource.
The type of the endpoint service.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource location.
A collection of security rules of the network security group.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The network traffic is allowed or denied.
A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used.
The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
The application security group specified as destination.
The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The destination port ranges.
The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic.

The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Network protocol this rule applies to.
The provisioning state of the public IP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
The CIDR or source IP ranges.
The application security group specified as source.
The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisk '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The source port ranges.
Resource tags.
Nat gateway associated with this subnet.
Resource ID.
The default security rules of network security group.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The network traffic is allowed or denied. Possible values are: 'Allow' and 'Deny'.
A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

The destination address prefix. CIDR or destination IP range. Asterisks '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used.
The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.
The application security group specified as destination.
The destination port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisks '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The destination port ranges.
The direction of the rule. The direction specifies if rule will be evaluated on incoming or outgoing traffic. Possible values are: 'Inbound' and 'Outbound'.

The priority of the rule. The value can be between 100 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.
Network protocol this rule applies to. Possible values are 'Tcp', 'Udp', and '*'.
The provisioning state of the public IP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

The CIDR or source IP range. Asterisks '*' can also be used to match all source IPs. Default tags such as 'VirtualNetwork', 'AzureLoadBalancer' and 'Internet' can also be used. If this is an ingress rule, specifies where network traffic originates from.
The CIDR or source IP ranges.
The application security group specified as source.
Resource ID.
Resource location.
Resource tags.
The source port or range. Integer or range between 0 and 65535. Asterisks '*' can also be used to match all ports.
The source port ranges.
The resource GUID property of the network security group resource.
The provisioning state of the resource.
Gets an array of references to the external resources using subnet.
Resource ID.
Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
Link to the external resource
Resource type of the linked resource.
The provisioning state of the resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.
Gets an array of references to services injecting into this subnet.
Resource ID.
Name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
Link to the external resource.
Resource type of the linked resource.
Gets a unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource location.
Whether to disable the routes learned by BGP on that route table. True means disable.
Collection of routes contained within a route table.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group. This name can be used to access the resource.
The destination CIDR to which the route applies.
The IP address packets should be forwarded to. Next hop values are only allowed in routes where the next hop type is VirtualAppliance.
The type of Azure hop the packet should be sent to.
The provisioning state of the resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.
Resource tags.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.

The name of the service to whom the subnet should be delegated (e.g. Microsoft.Sql/servers).
Name or ID of a network security group (NSG). Use null to detach it.
Name or ID of a route table to associate with the subnet. Use null to detach it.
